In these cases, in and of are interchangeable. Of relates to being a part of something, in relates to a group somebody is in . If you think of Argentina, the class and the USA, these are places , which also can be interpreted as entities , giving a reason why both prepositions can be used. However, I think that if you use of in the first sentence, it will give you the impression that Messi is one of the all-time greats of the Argentina football team, if not the greatest; however, in will imply that he is the best in the current Argentina football team.
